page.title: 14WESTFIELD MINE : MARKETS
page.content: One of the main reasons that Westfield Pit was developed in 1955 was as a supplier of{coal to power stations for {the generation of electricity. The coal is processed on site in the coal preparation plant, where it is washed and certain impurities are removed. The processed{coal of high quality}is sent to the coal-fired power station at{Longannet}and the{poorer quality coal waste from the preparation plant is sent to the power station at {Methil.}The remaining coal is available for distribution by coal retailers. The coal which goes to{Longannet}is carried by{rail}using the 'merry-go-round' system - the coal going to{Methil}is carried by{lorry} which brings about traffic congestion as these lorries travel fairly slowly.
